when_to_use: When end-to-end host connectivity fails in a small routed/BGP lab and you need to quickly localize whether the issue is L1/L2, host config, or routing/control-plane.
content: Use a layered, bidirectional validation sequence: (1) run host-to-host pings both directions and interpret ICMP source of failure; gateway-sourced "Destination Net Unreachable" strongly indicates missing routes rather than link failure. (2) Immediately verify host IP/mask/default-gateway via ip addr/ip route to confirm edge configuration is sane. (3) Verify router interface addressing and kernel routes to see whether only connected routes exist; absence of remote LAN routes corroborates the ICMP unreachable diagnosis. (4) Validate the transit link independently with router-to-router ping on the interconnect subnet to rule out dataplane issues between routers. This sequence works because it narrows the fault domain quickly and uses high-signal artifacts (ICMP unreachable origin + routing table contents) to distinguish routing/control-plane failure from physical/connectivity problems.
author: azure/gpt-5.2

when_to_use: When diagnosing routing issues on FRR-based routers and CLI commands like `vtysh` fail or time out.
content: Don’t assume FRR is running just because `/etc/frr/frr.conf` exists. First verify the control-plane binaries and processes (e.g., `which vtysh`, `ps -ef | grep -E 'zebra|bgpd'`, check expected install paths). If FRR isn’t present, pivot to kernel routing/connected routes and treat it as a control-plane absence rather than a BGP misconfiguration.
author: azure/gpt-5.2

when_to_use: When producing a diagnosis report that will be submitted/classified into a fixed root-cause taxonomy.
content: Map evidence to the closest available root-cause label and avoid over-claiming. If binaries are missing, distinguish ‘service down’ vs ‘software not installed’ in the narrative, but select the taxonomy label that best matches (e.g., `frr_service_down`) and explicitly cite the concrete evidence (missing `vtysh`, missing `zebra/bgpd`, only connected routes).
author: azure/gpt-5.2
